title: Create Development Storyboards
purpose: Describe the core function Create Development Storyboards.
guardrails: Focus on narrative clarity and camera planning; avoid detailed artwork or final textures
Use sketches or rough digital panels; do not invest in polished concept art during storyboarding
Keep panel sizes and formats consistent to ensure readability
Do not introduce new scenes without script approval from the narrative team
Maintain confidentiality of script content and restrict distribution to authorized personnel
Use consistent naming conventions for shots and panels throughout all documents
Document feedback and decisions transparently to track changes over time
Keep work within the R&D timeframe

tasks.title: Analyze script and identify scenes for storyboarding
tasks.description: Execute the task: Analyze script and identify scenes for storyboarding.

deliverables.description: A spreadsheet listing potential scenes to storyboard with notes on new scene ideas and recommendations.

acceptance.text: Lists all scenes identified from the script or outline.
Includes new scene suggestions with justification.
Reviewed against the narrative script or outline.

tasks.title: Develop a shot list
tasks.description: Execute the task: Develop a shot list.

deliverables.description: A detailed shot list specifying lens, framing and sequential visual descriptions for each shot.

acceptance.text: Contains lens, framing, and description for each shot.
Cross‑references scene outlines and style references.

tasks.title: Draft rough thumbnails
tasks.description: Execute the task: Draft rough thumbnails.

deliverables.description: A collection of rough thumbnail sketches showing each shot in sequence, illustrating basic composition and blocking.

acceptance.text: Includes thumbnails for every shot from the shot list.
Sketches are legible and indicate composition clearly.

tasks.title: Create detailed storyboard
tasks.description: Execute the task: Create detailed storyboard.

deliverables.description: Detailed storyboard panels for the selected scenes, compiled into a PDF with annotations for camera, action and dialogue.

acceptance.text: Each panel includes camera, action and dialogue annotations.
Panels follow the rough thumbnails and narrative outline.
Artwork is consistent with the project’s mood and style guidelines.

deliverables.description: Polished storyboard panels with clean lines and final annotations prepared for production.

acceptance.text: All panels are refined to production‑ready quality.
Aligns with the approved story and tone.

deliverables.description: An animatic video built from the clean storyboard panels, timed to visualize pacing and flow.

acceptance.text: Combines panels with timing to match the script.
Duration and pacing align with scene requirements.
Plays smoothly at the target frame rate.
